title.narrative: KAZSTAT: Strengthening the National Statistical System of Kazakhstan

description.narrative: The main objective of the project is to improve efficiency and effectiveness of the national statistical system to provide relevant, timely and reliable data in line with internationallyaccepted methodology and best practices. The project will upgrade the conceptual, methodological and analytical skills of the ASRK and other data producer and user agencies ofthe country. This will position the ASRK to respond quickly and effectively to the new needs and priorities that will arise in the future. The main beneficiaries ofthe project outcomes are the ASRK, the Government and the general public as well as international development partners.The principal outcome of this project will be an improved national statistical system that can inform the Government#s decision-making processby providing timely and accurateeconomic and social data. It will also help Government monitor progress towards national development goals. The specific outputs of the project are:improved institutional framework that will encourage statistical development; improved information technology (IT) infrastructure; strengthened human resources through training in statistical operations; improved statistical infrastructure through application of internationally accepted methodologies and data quality standards; developed statistical production system that continuously adapts to evolving needs of the society and economy through user-producer dialogues; institutionalized core statistical activities, including poverty monitoring;increased output of reliable statistics by consolidating andstrengthening existing surveys and administrative sources, and by designing and conducting new data-generating activities; and timely dissemination, information-sharing, and the use of data for policy decisions.

title.narrative: Statistical outputs are released within the time limits and with frequency meeting the SDDS requirements
CS central and local level structure optimized and staff trained including staff from relevant ministries and agencies.
Statistical products are easily accessible in relevant media with metadata and interpretation of findings
Internationally accepted statistical techniques in collection, compilation, and authenticity verification are applied and regular validations are carried out for data sources and statistical products
User satisfaction rates have significantly increased by the closing date
Internationally accepted classifications standards and methodologies are adapted and used in data production.

baseline.value: Amending of accepted classifications when required.

target.value: Statistics data generated by the Agency fully meets the international requirements to classifications and standards.

actual.value: The metadata base system of maintaining and updating classifications and glossaries was designed and implemented. Basic scope ofmetadata covering internationally accepted standards, classifications and definitions was introduced and is updated. The extensionof the scope of metadata is continued. The ARKS metadata base can be used as the best practice for use of other nationalstatistical offices. The adoption of international standards is the continuous work. The ARKS has organized efficient system ofmonitoring the changes of international standards and evaluation of the necessity of their adoption to national needs.CS expertsreceived trainings on methodology of National accounts, GDP by expenditure, GDP Export and Imports, Structural, Price, Industrial,Construction and Investment, Agriculture, Environment, Services, ICT, Trade, Science and Innovations, Tourism and Socio-economicstatistics. All together 22 consulting missions and 8 study visits were conducted over the reporti

title.narrative: Mechanisms for effective inter-agency coordination are established and operational.

baseline.value: Committee coordinates statistical actions and collection of official data. There is no complex evaluation about applicability ofinformation generated as a result of research.

title.narrative: Mechanisms for effective dialogue with the data users and providers are operational

baseline.value: Has not completed yet. Users satisfaction polling by independent experts is not ensured.

target.value: Effective dialogue between users and producers of statistical data is in place.

actual.value: Effective dialogue between users and producers of statistical data is in place.

title.narrative: Standard questionnaires for surveys developed and applied.

target.value: Rules for approval of statistical forms for nation-wide and sector-specific statistical surveys, guidelines for completing thembased on international recommendations are in practice.

actual.value: Rules for approval of statistical forms for nation-wide and sector-specific statistical surveys, guidelines for completing thembased on international recommendations are in practice.

title.narrative: Registers are compiled and being maintained.

baseline.value: Regular work is in progress. However, there are difficulties with registers updating, using data for research.

target.value: All registers are properly maintained and applied to generate samples.

actual.value: Business, Population, Housing stock and Agricultural registers are properly setup and getting ready to generate samples.

title.narrative: All relevant staff at CS have workstations with access to databases for analysis and tabulations.

target.value: All statistical staff is equipped with the ICT and has the access to internet, however the quality of hardware and software needsupdating.

actual.value: All statistical staff is equipped with the ICT and has the access to internet.The CATI system should be operational at the end of2016. The pilot survey is foreseen in February 2017 using the CATI system.

title.narrative: ICT Capacity for operations is adequate and well maintained.

target.value: Up to date ICT network and equipment.

actual.value: Networking equipment (high-performance core switches and security equipment) is purchased, delivered and installed and adopted.
